alert.note: Alert for Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pitkin County through 500 PM MDT... At 414 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Mt Massive, or 41 miles southeast of Glenwood Springs, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Pitkin County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys
